Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.Actor
      • Player
  • public class Player
extends greenfoot.Actor
    The player class. Each player (1 or 2) is a member of this class. This class handles interactions between the player and other objects in the game. Players can move, run into walls, speed up, slow down, and change image depending on the direction they are facing.
    Version:
    November 17, 2019
    Author:
    Eric Zhang

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player​(int playerId)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        playerId - Determines whether the player is player 1 or player 2.

    • Method Detail

      • act

        public void act()
        Act - do whatever the Player wants to do. This method is called whenever the 'Act' or 'Run' button gets pressed in the environment.
        Overrides:
        act in class greenfoot.Actor

      • checkKeyPress

        public void checkKeyPress​(int playerId)
        Checks for user input.

      • collisionCheck

        public void collisionCheck()
        Checks if the player is touching an obstacle and which direction the player is facing, then moves the player in the opposite direction. The opposite direction movement cancels out any keyboard entries, so the player does not move.

      • entityCheck

        public void entityCheck()
        Checks for touching entities. If an Entity is being touched, the method will play the corresponding sound and adjust the correct stat, before removing the Entity from the world.

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        Called to check if the player has inputted on their keyboard. Villains will not attack until this method returns true.
        Returns:
        Whether the player is ready.

      • reportStats

        public int reportStats​(java.lang.String stat)
        Reports a specific player stat.
        Parameters:
        stat - The name of the variable to be returned in the method.
        Returns:
        An integer stat of the player specified in the parameter 'stat'.

      • smartMove

        public void smartMove​(int vector1,
                      int vector2,
                      boolean bounce)
        Takes two values to...
        Parameters:
        vector1 - Either 1 for a positive direction (north or east), or -1 for a negative direction (south or west)
        vector2 - Integer used to represent the cardinal points. 1 is used to represent north, 2 is used to represent east, 3 is used to represent south, 4 is used to represent west.
        bounce - Whether the image of the player should be changed. True will not change the image, false will change the image.

      • villainDamage

        public void villainDamage()
        Checks if the player is touching a villain, subtracts a life, then if all lives are gone, the endGame method is called in the world.
